title: Sampling Distribution of a Median
question_text: All of the numbers from $1$ to $50$ are written on slips of paper and placed in a hat.  The slips are thoroughly mixed, five slips of paper are chosen, and the median is recorded.  This process is repeated a total of $150\text{ times}$ and the medians are displayed in a dotplot: Created for Albert.io. Copyright 2017. All rights reserved. Based on this sampling distribution, which of the following statements is true?

choices.text: There is a 2 % 2 % chance of obtaining a sample median of 45 45 or more.
There is no chance of obtaining a sample median of 45 45 or more because the population median is 25.5 25.5 .
There is an 8.7 % 8.7 % chance of obtaining a sample median less than 15 15 .
There is a 12.7 % 12.7 % chance of obtaining a sample median less than 15 15 .
There is an 87.3 % 87.3 % chance of obtaining a sample median less than 15 15 .
